oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hattie Cotton Elementary School Clean-Up Parade, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1955, Vol. 1 p. 91
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph from Hattie Cotton Elementary School's Clean-Up Parade in April of 1955. Photographer unknown. Photo used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1955. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
